title: 'Vaccines can and do cause autism,' says Bexar County DA, taking controversial stance
author: Claire Cardona
description: In a video posted to Facebook, the Bexar County District Attorney sided with those who say vaccines cause autism."I'm Nico Lahood, I'm the criminal...
cleaned_text: In a video posted to Facebook, the Bexar County district attorney sides with those who say vaccines cause autism. "I'm Nico Lahood, I'm the criminal district attorney in San Antonio, Texas," he says from behind a desk. "I'm here to tell you vaccines can and do cause autism." The 20-second clip [was posted Friday](https://www.facebook.com/autismmediachannel/videos/1115031715238223/?hc_ref=PAGES_TIMELINE) by the Autism Media Channel. The video ends with a slide announcing "Niko's (sic) story coming August 30, 2016," and a plug for the documentary, Vaxxed: From Cover-Up to Catastrophe. LaHood screened the documentary at a local movie theater, the [San Antonio Express-News](http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/local/article/Bexar-County-District-Attorney-Nico-LaHood-9190563.php#photo-9810062) reported, citing a source invited to the presentation. According to [The Washington Post, ](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2016/05/25/7-things-about-vaccines-and-autism-that-the-movie-vaxxed-wont-tell-you/)the documentary is directed by Andrew Wakefield, a former British surgeon who moved to Texas after being [stripped of his medical license](http://www.dallasnews.com/news/local-news/20160627-introducing-debunked-dr.-yasmin-separates-fact-from-fiction-about-science-and-medicine.ece) for lying in a study that claimed the measles, mumps and rubella vaccine caused autism and digestive problems. [Debunked: Do vaccines cause autism?](http://www.dallasnews.com/news/local-news/20160627-introducing-debunked-dr.-yasmin-separates-fact-from-fiction-about-science-and-medicine.ece) [Debunked: Do vaccines cause autism?](http://www.dallasnews.com/news/local-news/20160627-introducing-debunked-dr.-yasmin-separates-fact-from-fiction-about-science-and-medicine.ece) LaHood told the Express-News on Monday that his "is not a politically correct opinion." "We had a very normally developed child, meeting all the marks as a child — walking, eye contact ... and after his 18-month vaccination, we had a very different child," LaHood, who was elected in 2014, told the paper. "And our story is not alone. I mean, there's thousands of parents out there that have the same story. So my opinions are just my opinions as a daddy, as a husband who happens to be the DA." There is [no scientific evidence](http://www.cdc.gov/vaccinesafety/concerns/autism.html) linking vaccines to autism, and anti-vaccination critics have warned about a re-emergence of diseases such as measles and whooping cough. [Interactive: Trend of no vaccines worries doctors](http://interactives.dallasnews.com/2016/vaccinations/) State figures released this month show that the number of Texas parents refusing to have their children vaccinated for nonmedical reasons rose nearly 9 percent last year, [the Houston Chronicle reported. ](http://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Vaccine-exemptions-on-the-rise-among-Texas-9142343.php) About 45,000 of the state's 5.5 million schoolchildren — about .84 percent — were not vaccinated due to "conscientious exemption." In 2003, the year Texas began allowing exemptions, that number was closer to 3,000. The number of students in Dallas ISD who were not vaccinated for reasons of conscience or religious belief totals less than 1 percent, though some schools have higher rates. In January [, a Plano ISD student who had traveled internationally](http://thescoopblog.dallasnews.com/2016/01/measles-case-confirmed-at-plano-isd-elementary-school.html/?_ga=1.155593787.1804180417.1468878071) developed measles and could have potentially exposed classmates to the infection, which has been generally eradicated in the U.S., officials said. The Collin County health agency's chief epidemiologist said the child had not been vaccinated. The Associated Press contributed to this rpeort.
